verses.kjv: My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, with respect of persons.
verses.ct: My brothers and sisters, as believers in our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, you must not show favoritism.

verses.kjv: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment;
verses.ct: Suppose someone walks into your gathering wearing a gold ring and expensive clothing, and a poor person also comes in wearing shabby clothing.

verses.kjv: And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:
verses.ct: If you give special attention to the well-dressed person and say, 'Please, take this excellent seat,' but tell the poor person, 'Stand over there,' or 'Sit on the floor by my feet' —

verses.kjv: Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?
verses.ct: haven't you created divisions among yourselves and become judges with corrupt motives?

verses.kjv: Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?
verses.ct: Listen, my dear brothers and sisters. Hasn't God chosen those who are poor in this world to be rich in faith and to inherit the kingdom he promised to those who love him?

verses.kjv: But ye have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?
verses.ct: But you have dishonored the poor. Aren't the wealthy the ones who exploit you and drag you into court?

verses.kjv: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?
verses.ct: Aren't they the ones who insult the honorable name that was given to you?

verses.kjv: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:
verses.ct: If you are truly keeping the royal law found in Scripture — 'Love your neighbor as yourself' — then you are doing right.

verses.kjv: But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.
verses.ct: But if you show favoritism, you are committing sin, and the law exposes you as violators.

verses.kjv: For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one point, he is guilty of all.
verses.ct: Whoever obeys the entire law but stumbles on just one point is guilty of breaking all of it.

verses.kjv: For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill. Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.
verses.ct: The one who said, 'Do not commit adultery,' also said, 'Do not murder.' So even if you haven't committed adultery, if you murder someone, you have become a lawbreaker.

verses.kjv: So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.
verses.ct: So speak and act as people who will be judged by the law that sets us free.

verses.kjv: For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.
verses.ct: Because judgment will be merciless toward anyone who has shown no mercy. But mercy triumphs over judgment.

verses.kjv: What doth it profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?
verses.ct: What good is it, my brothers and sisters, if someone claims to have faith but doesn't back it up with actions? Can that kind of faith save them?

verses.kjv: If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,
verses.ct: If a brother or sister has no clothes to wear and no food for the day,

verses.kjv: And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be ye warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what doth it profit?
verses.ct: and one of you tells them, 'Go in peace, stay warm and eat well,' but doesn't give them what they actually need for their body — what good does that do?

verses.kjv: Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.
verses.ct: In the same way, faith by itself, without actions to go with it, is dead.

verses.kjv: Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.
verses.ct: But someone will argue, 'You have faith, and I have actions.' Show me your faith apart from any actions, and I will show you my faith through my actions.

verses.kjv: Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.
verses.ct: You believe that there is one God. Good for you! Even the demons believe that — and they shudder in terror.

verses.kjv: But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?
verses.ct: But do you really need proof, you foolish person, that faith without actions is dead?

verses.kjv: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?
verses.ct: Wasn't our ancestor Abraham declared righteous because of his actions when he offered his son Isaac on the altar?

verses.kjv: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?
verses.ct: Can you see how his faith and his actions worked together, and his faith was made complete through what he did?

verses.kjv: And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.
verses.ct: This fulfilled what Scripture says: 'Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.' He was even called the Friend of God.

verses.kjv: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.
verses.ct: So you can see that a person is declared righteous by their actions, and not by faith alone.

verses.kjv: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sent them out another way?
verses.ct: In the same way, wasn't Rahab the prostitute also declared righteous because of her actions — when she welcomed the spies and sent them away by a different route?

verses.kjv: For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.
verses.ct: Just as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without actions is dead as well.
